channel.title: Podcasting for Business
channel.description: Podcasting for Business sets out to educate sales, marketing, brand and advertising professionals on what PodWorx, Inc. calls the Four P's of Corporate and Business Podcasting: Plan, Produce, Publish and Promote.
channel.itunes:summary: PodWorx, Inc. -- Internet Broadcasting Company - Las Vegas, Nevada
channel.itunes:author: Scott Whitney
channel.itunes:subtitle: PodWorx, Inc. -- Internet Broadcasting Company - Las Vegas, Nevada

item.title: 07: Podcasting Return on Investment / Return on Influence [podcast]
item.dc:creator: Scott Whitney
item.description: Just because something is cool, doesn’t mean it shouldn’t be measured. For today’s show, we’ll talk about podcasting Return on Investment and Return on Influence. Show notes: When to talk about ROI Your job revisited Reminder: What a podcast is Real world examples Return on Investment Return on Influence. . . Comparative Influence Data Exposure [...]
item.content:encoded:
Just because something is cool, doesn’t mean it shouldn’t be measured. For today’s show, we’ll talk about podcasting Return on Investment and Return on Influence. Show notes:

  • When to talk about ROI
  • Your job revisited
  • Reminder: What a podcast is
  • Real world examples Return on Investment
  • Return on Influence. . .
  • Comparative Influence
  • Data Exposure
  • Time Exposure
  • Location Exposure
  • Online Exposure
  • Other Measurements
item.itunes:subtitle: Just because something is cool, doesn't mean it shouldn't be measured. For today's show, we'll talk about podcasting Return on Investment and Return on Influence. Show notes: - When to talk about ROI Your job revisited
item.itunes:summary:
Just because something is cool, doesn't mean it shouldn't be measured. For today's show, we'll talk about podcasting Return on Investment and Return on Influence. Show notes:
* When to talk about ROI * Your job revisited * Reminder: What a podcast is * Real world examples Return on Investment * Return on Influence. . . * Comparative Influence * Data Exposure * Time Exposure * Location Exposure * Online Exposure * Other Measurements
item.itunes:author: Scott Whitney

item.title: 06: Making Interviews Interesting to Your Listeners [podcast]
item.dc:creator: Scott Whitney
item.description: If you recognize that a good corporate podcast helps to ‘humanize’ your company, it stands to reason that hearing from the very humans responsible for the day-to-day efforts of your company makes sense. For today’s show, you’ll learn one technique PodWorx uses to produce an interview with your employees that speaks directly to your audience. [...]
item.content:encoded:
If you recognize that a good corporate podcast helps to ‘humanize’ your company, it stands to reason that hearing from the very humans responsible for the day-to-day efforts of your company makes sense. For today’s show, you’ll learn one technique PodWorx uses to produce an interview with your employees that speaks directly to your audience. Show notes:

  • Why interview?
  • A producer’s two responsibilities
  • What doesn’t work
  • Bonding with your audience
  • Establishing credibility
  • Pre-Interviews
  • Interview Questions
  • I’m not Dan Rather!
  • An introduction sample
  • Final thoughts
item.itunes:subtitle: If you recognize that a good corporate podcast helps to 'humanize' your company, it stands to reason that hearing from the very humans responsible for the day-to-day efforts of your company makes sense
item.itunes:summary:
If you recognize that a good corporate podcast helps to 'humanize' your company, it stands to reason that hearing from the very humans responsible for the day-to-day efforts of your company makes sense. For today's show, you'll learn one technique PodWorx uses to produce an interview with your employees that speaks directly to your audience. Show notes:
* Why interview? * A producer's two responsibilities * What doesn't work * Bonding with your audience * Establishing credibility * Pre-Interviews * Interview Questions * I'm not Dan Rather! * An introduction sample * Final thoughts
item.itunes:author: Scott Whitney

item.title: 05: Intracasts(tm) [podcast]
item.dc:creator: Scott Whitney
item.description: Many companies are struggling to figure out a creative way to provide content to their own employees. For today’s show, we introduce the listener to the concept of an Intracast(tm)–a podcast developed for the most important people in your company–your employees. Show notes: External podcast fans Quick list of external podcast ideas Four questions about [...]
item.content:encoded:
Many companies are struggling to figure out a creative way to provide content to their own employees. For today’s show, we introduce the listener to the concept of an Intracast(tm)–a podcast developed for the most important people in your company–your employees. Show notes:

  • External podcast fans
  • Quick list of external podcast ideas
  • Four questions about employee communications
  • What’s not working now
  • Intracast(tm) defined
  • Intracast audience
  • Intracast show ideas
item.itunes:subtitle: Many companies are struggling to figure out a creative way to provide content to their own employees. For today's show, we introduce the listener to the concept of an Intracast(tm)--a podcast developed for the most important people in your company--...

item.title: 03: Review of the Living in Las Vegas Podcast Listener Survey [podcast]
item.dc:creator: Scott Whitney
item.description: We are often asked about podcast listener demographics. For today’s show, we review in detail the results of the listener survey conducted for the Living In Las Vegas podcast, a show produced by PodWorx. Show notes: Why survey? How to get higher response rate Podtrac Survey results Demographics, Behavior, Shopping, Satisfaction, Likes and Dislikes
item.content:encoded:
We are often asked about podcast listener demographics. For today’s show, we review in detail the results of the listener survey conducted for the Living In Las Vegas podcast, a show produced by PodWorx. Show notes:

  • Why survey?
  • How to get higher response rate
  • Podtrac
  • Survey results
  • Demographics, Behavior, Shopping, Satisfaction, Likes and Dislikes
item.itunes:subtitle: We are often asked about podcast listener demographics. For today's show, we review in detail the results of the listener survey conducted for the Living In Las Vegas podcast, a show produced by PodWorx. Show notes: - Why survey?

item.title: 02: The Two Problems Your Business Podcast can Solve [podcast]
item.dc:creator: Scott Whitney
item.description: Today’s show focuses on the two problems facing every business today that can be solved by implementing a well planned, produced, published and promoted corporate podcast. Show notes: The problem with sizzle or steak You bond on problems, not your solution The two problems facing every business Email marketing $200 billion in spending on advertising [...]
item.content:encoded:
Today’s show focuses on the two problems facing every business today that can be solved by implementing a well planned, produced, published and promoted corporate podcast. Show notes:

  • The problem with sizzle or steak
  • You bond on problems, not your solution
  • The two problems facing every business
  • Email marketing
  • $200 billion in spending on advertising
  • Urban noise and your customers
  • Functional Equivalency
  • The Law of Leadership–and the risks
item.itunes:subtitle: Today's show focuses on the two problems facing every business today that can be solved by implementing a well planned, produced, published and promoted corporate podcast. Show notes: - The problem with sizzle or steak
